data.title: ElGamal Algorithm
data.meta_description: The ElGamal cryptosystem [6] is a public-key encryption scheme proposed by Taher ElGamal in 1985. He was a Ph.D. student of Martin Hellman, the co-inventor of the Diffie-Hellman key exchange algorithm.
